Read a VCF file with the genotypes use for the ancestry call

Source: R/tools_internal.R
readSNVBAM.Rd

The function reads VCF file and returns a data frame containing the information about the read counts for the SNVs present in the file.

readSNVBAM(
  fileName,
  varSelected,
  offset = 0L,
  paramSNVBAM = list(ScanBamParam = NULL, PileupParam = NULL, yieldSize = 1e+07),
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

fileName

a character string representing the name, including the path, of a BAM file with the index file in the same directory

varSelected

a data.frame representing the position to keep

offset

a integer representing the offset to be added to the position of the SNVs. The value of offset is added to the position present in the file. Default: 0L.

paramSNVBAM

a data.frame representing

verbose

a logical indicating if messages should be printed to show how the different steps in the function. Default: FALSE.

Value

a data.frame containing at least:

Chromosome

a numeric representing the name of the chromosome

Position

a numeric representing the position on the chromosome

Ref

a character string representing the reference nucleotide

Alt

a character string representing the alternative nucleotide

File1R

a numeric representing the count for the reference nucleotide

File1A

a numeric representing the count for the alternative nucleotide

count

a numeric representing the total count

Author

Pascal Belleau, Astrid Deschênes and Alexander Krasnitz

Examples



## Directory where demo SNP-pileup file
dataDir <- system.file("extdata/example/snpPileup", package="RAIDS")

Contents
